ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: and the night when it conceals it
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: The night when it covers him over,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: and by the night as it envelopes the sun;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: by the night when it covers the earth with darkness,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And by oath of the night when it hides it
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: By the night as it Yaghshaha.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And the night when it draws a veil over it,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: and by the night when it enshrouds him!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And the night when it enshroudeth him,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: and by the night when it draws a veil over it,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: By the night; when it envelopeth him,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: by the night when it covers her,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: By the Night as it conceals it;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And by the night as it conceals it (the sun);
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: by the night, when it envelops it!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And the night as it conceals it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And [by] the night when it covers it
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [91:4] and [by] the night when it enshrouds her, covering her up with its darkness (idhā, ‘when’, in all three instances is an absolute adverbial, operated by the verbal action of the oath).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: And the night when it enshroudeth him) and the night when it enshrouds the light of day and the day reveals the darkness of the night,
